events.message: The insured reported an auto accident involving a rear-end collision on the highway during rush hour.
The claim was categorised under Auto Accident due to vehicle damage sustained in the collision.
An agent was assigned to the case to oversee the vehicle accident claim and client communications.
The insured received an acknowledgement confirming that the auto accident claim is now officially logged.
Requested photographs of the damaged vehicle, police report, and insurance card for further processing.
The insured has submitted all requested documents including detailed images of the car and official reports.
Investigation began to verify circumstances of the vehicle collision and assess the extent of damage.
Investigation concluded with confirmation that the insured was not at fault in the rear-end accident.
A fair settlement amount was proposed to cover the repair costs of the damaged vehicle.
The insured expressed satisfaction with the prompt handling and proposed settlement offer.
The claim was officially approved based on the investigation and review of submitted documentation.
Payment for the approved settlement was issued to the insured to cover vehicle repairs.
The vehicle accident claim was closed successfully following receipt of payment by the insured.
All claim documents and records were archived securely for future reference and audit purposes.
